Content: [dscrd-hush] <CrypThor> Hi, I have some hush in my wallet in transparent balance. Do I need to do anything  for the new chain? Thank you

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> @CrypThor Hi, your balance have been transferred to the new chain. You should no longer use the address beginning with 't1' but where new addresses start with 'R'.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> By connecting to the HUSHmate wallet or web wallet, you will get your new address and you will see your balance.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> @dukeleto curious whose suggestion it was to reimburse cryptopia for the stolen funds. Was it brought up from Hush team or exchange side?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CrypThor> @gilardh  Thank you for that. I have downloaded the new hushmate. Do I  just add the old DAT file in the new wallet folder for my coins to show up?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CrypThor see pinned messages

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Eddy O it was my decision because that is what I thought was the right thing to do. And I see it as reimbursing HUSH HODLers (95% of which had their funds on Cryptopia), not the exchange. HUSH v3 has the ability to give back all funds to all people who were stolen from, via Cryptopia, but we need Cryptopia's support in that. We cannot directly give back the funds, only Cryptopia knows exactly how much HUSH each of their customers/addresses has

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If you would like to see your HUSH on Cryptopia sooner, please open a support ticket with them

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> We are waiting on them at this point, and if they see that a lot of people care about HUSH, maybe that will make them move faster.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Be nice, be respectful. But also "the squeaky wheel gets the grease" is a saying for a reason

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CrypThor> @dukeleto  I have and it's a bit confusing as to where we add the commands. Sorry for being so illiterate in this regard.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CrypThor it's ok, we are improving docs, trying to make things easier. None of this is easy and nobody went to school for it ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CrypThor what OS are you using, and what familiarity with the command line do you have?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we are still improving our GUI wallet situation

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you are on the bleeding edge ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ok, if things are backed up, that is very good

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Here is the high level deal

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You can use an old Hush wallet.dat with the new HUSH v3, but you just need to give it a special CLI flag the first time, `-zapwallettxes`, which clears out old transactions from the old network, which would not be valid on HUSH v3

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> `./hushd -zapwallettxes` from the terminal

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> after you have backed up everything, and then copied your old wallet.dat to the new location

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I don't use windows and don't have that file path memorized

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's ~/.komodo/HUSH3/ in Linux or ~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/HUSH3/ on a mac

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i think my brain purposefully forgets anything related to windows ðŸ˜…

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> see, we need this better documented. I can see how this is not as easy as it could be
